title: Manchester City transfer news: Leonardo Bonucci puts City and Chelsea on red alert after falling out with Juventus boss Max Allegri
text:
EFL Pep's got bon appetit Manchester City transfer news: Leonardo Bonucci puts City and Chelsea on red alert after falling out with Juventus boss Max Allegri 
Italian centre-back has been described by Pep Guardiola as one of his favourite players By MARTIN BLACKBURN Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments LEONARDO BONUCCI has put Manchester City and Chelsea on red alert after falling out with Juventus coach Max Allegri. 
Etihad chief Pep Guardiola has described the £50million-rated Italy international as one of his favourite players. Getty Images 5 Leonardo Bonucci has put Manchester City and Chelsea on red alert by falling out with Juventus boss Max Allegri 
City had an approach knocked back last summer but the club will look at a major defensive overhaul in the close season and the centre-back, 29, could again be on their radar.

That was the player’s punishment for clashing with boss Allegri in front of TV cameras during an earlier victory over Palermo. Allegri says the issue has been resolved now that Bonucci has apologised. 
But reports in Italy claim the defender could still be on his way out in the summer. 
Guardiola will be in the market for at least one centre-half in the close season. 
While Chelsea chief Antonio Conte knows Bonucci well from his time as Juve boss.
